attributes.action: No more Mosques and Islamic schools in Middlesbrough
attributes.additional_details:
The mosques we already have are for one faith and Muslims are expected to integrate with the British people but what seems to be happening is Muslims forcing their religion and practices on us and not accepting our Christian values and beliefs is creating a huge division and until Muslims accept these then and only then will we be able to live in peace.

We are proud of our Heritage, Values, Beliefs and do not wan't any other Religion over shadowing ours.
attributes.background: Middlesbrough is a friendly close knit community with many ethnic groups of people whom have lived together over the decades. Accepting many faiths such as Sikhs, Hinduism and many cultures that have lived peacefully along side each other while feeling that theirs no division or segregation.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

If you want to raise concerns about planning decisions or education provision in your local area, you could contact your local councillor. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor
